alert.note: Alert for Eastern Rutland; Eastern Windsor; Orange; Western Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 12:38PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Orange, east central Rutland and northwestern Windsor Counties through 130 PM EDT... At 1238 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Killington, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Barnard, Tunbridge, Sharon, Killington, Bethel, Randolph, Strafford, Stockbridge, Bridgewater, Mendon, Royalton, Pomfret, Vershire, Brookfield, Plymouth, Chelsea, Shrewsbury, West Fairlee, South Tunbridge and East Randolph. This includes Interstate 89 between mile markers 12 and 35. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central and southern Vermont.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Rutland; Eastern Windsor; Orange; Western Windsor
